page.title: 13ARBROATH,NATURE TRAIL.
page.content: This walk, situated to the east of Arbroath ,is approximately three miles long, and follows a path along the clifftops . There is ample car parking at the start. As well as seeing interesting shapes carved by the sea in the red sandstone,you will see a variety of plants and bird life. There are the common plants like, kidney vetch, birds foot treefoil, sea plantain, sea pinks but there is also the opportunity to glimpse or study the rarer heath spotted orchis and early purple orchis. For birdwatcher ,too, there is plenty to see, herring gulls,fulmars,cormorants,puffins,terns and guillemots.on the landward side you might see peewits,cornbuntings, etc. This is a pleasant walk,but do take care- cliffs can be dangerous!
